data.title: [ci skip] Fix js parser use resource path name for font name when font name is blank in BMFontLoader and ButtonLoader
fix iOS downloader crash when storage path contains spaces
data.body:
This PR fixes https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/14842
which causes iOS downloader to crash when storagePath contains spaces (e.g. the app's Application Support directory)

This problem can either be fixed by changing

```
[NSURL URLWithString:[prefix stringByAppendingString: destPath]];
```

to 

```
[NSURL URLWithString:[[prefix stringByAppendingString: destPath] stringByAddingPercentEscapesUsingEncoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding]];
```

or

```
destURL = [NSURL fileURLWithPath:destPath];
```

which is more concise.

data.title: [BUG]iOS downloader crashes when storagePath contains spaces
data.body:
since downloader is using [NSURL urlWithString:] to convert absolute path NSString to NSURL, and when the NSString path contains characters like ' ' which needs to be escaped, the method will return nil thus crashing the downloader.

An example path containing space is iOS's "Application Support" directory.

data.title: Sample for better controller input handling
data.body:
I wrote this https://gist.github.com/seivan/2d8ee225e0310ccec277 for unifying methods for managing input.
It could be better than the current touch systems implemented and avoid the bug with two events on left-clicking if the code implemented both mouse and touch. 
This makes it more agnostic.

data.title: cocos run -p mac does compile work even when no file has changed.
data.body:
Downloaded 3.9, following the instructions:

```
cocos new example -l js
cd example
cocos compile -p mac
cocos run -p mac
```

Now invoke:

```
cocos run -p mac
```

again, and the xcodebuild process will re-run libtool on the cocos libraries, process the plist, link the app, copy resources, touch the app bundle, and 'register with launch services'.  This takes much longer than it should, considering the app is already built and no source file has changed.

This happens every time.

Running the xcodebuild command directly from the command line, e.g.:

```
xcodebuild -project "/usr/local/emk/src/example/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.ios_mac/example.xcodeproj" -configuration Debug -target "example-desktop" CONFIGURATION_BUILD_DIR="/usr/local/emk/src/example/simulator/mac"
```

Causes the next build to complete more quickly as it skips the libtool step.  But invoke `cocos run -p mac` again and you're back to doing building work every time.
